original_title: CPC revises fuel prices; petrol 92 increased
original_body_lines: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has revised fuel prices effective from midnight on Friday (June 30).
Under the new price revision, Petrol 92 Octane will now be sold at Rs. 328 per litre, showing an increase of Rs. 10 from the previous rate.
Conversely, Petrol 95 Octane has seen a decrease of Rs. 20 per litre, bringing the new price to Rs. 365.

Ceypetco has also adjusted the prices of diesel. Auto Diesel now stands at Rs. 308 per litre, reflecting a reduction of Rs. 2. On the other hand, the price of Super Diesel has increased by Rs. 6, reaching Rs. 346 per litre.
Additionally, the price of kerosene has dropped by Rs. 6, resulting in a revised rate of Rs. 236 per litre.
